Bard 6/Red Dragon Disciple 4/Arcane Archer 10, Elf, any non-lawful, PvM

This is the pre-epic, fledgling version of the Dragon Archer with the minimum (2d10) dragon breath. It is comparable to several other pre-epic AA builds, but slightly more balanced from those I've created with other classes and avoids the infamous XP penalty. It is a pure archer without weapon finesse for melee. Let us compare and contrast, eh?

edit: BTW, the only reason the RDD class was inserted in this build to begin with was to take advantage in an environment that contains mighty bows maxed at +2 strength modifier on them. It is more-or-less just a cheesy way to drag in some epic Grt Str feats at the cost of a much more versatile feat selection of the fighter class. Also, the draconic +AC is an added benefit along with the ability to bump spell saves within the RDD pseudo-fighter levels and a far superior skill set to boot.

Notes

1. No kiting archer should ever be caught flat-footed or flanked so the benefit of Blind fight is distilled down to rerolls on concealed foe misses. Low HPs are typically not an issue for a well-played archer but can help survive surprise trap damage (re: vs. Search skill). Creature summons can handle all traps and aid in escaping a collapsing kite.
